title: Capability
description:
A grouping and boundary mechanism developers can use to separate windows or plugins functionality from each other at runtime.

If a window is not matching any capability then it has no access to the IPC layer at all.

This can be done to create trust groups and reduce impact of vulnerabilities in certain plugins or windows. Windows can be added to a capability by exact name or glob patterns like *, admin-* or main-window.

remote.description: Configure remote URLs that can use the capability permissions.

local.description: Whether this capability is enabled for local app URLs or not. Defaults to `true`.

windows.description:
List of windows that uses this capability. Can be a glob pattern.

On multiwebview windows, prefer [`Self::webviews`] for a fine grained access control.

webviews.description:
List of webviews that uses this capability. Can be a glob pattern.

This is only required when using on multiwebview contexts, by default all child webviews of a window that matches [`Self::windows`] are linked.

permissions.description: List of permissions attached to this capability. Must include the plugin name as prefix in the form of `${plugin-name}:${permission-name}`.

platforms.description: Target platforms this capability applies. By default all platforms are affected by this capability.

CapabilityRemote.description: Configuration for remote URLs that are associated with the capability.

urls.description:
Remote domains this capability refers to using the [URLPattern standard](https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/).

# Examples

- "https://*.mydomain.dev": allows subdomains of mydomain.dev - "https://mydomain.dev/api/*": allows any subpath of mydomain.dev/api

PermissionEntry.description: An entry for a permission value in a [`Capability`] can be either a raw permission [`Identifier`] or an object that references a permission and extends its scope.

anyOf.description: Reference a permission or permission set by identifier.
Reference a permission or permission set by identifier and extends its scope.

identifier.description: Identifier of the permission or permission set.

allow.description: Data that defines what is allowed by the scope.

deny.description: Data that defines what is denied by the scope.

anyOf.description: Represents a map of [`String`] keys to [`Value`]s.
